title: Kacey Musgraves reveals she penned two songs while tripping and praises LSD for 'opening your mind'
text:
Six-time Grammy winner Kacey Musgraves confessed that she penned two songs off her fourth studio album Golden Hour while dropping acid on her porch last year.

'Slow Burn and Mother,' the 31-year-old country crooner revealed in a W magazine video on Wednesday.

'I was sitting on the porch and, you know, I was just having a good easy zen time. I wrote it down on my phone and then wrote the songs the next day with a sober mind.'

The raven-haired Texan - whose debut single Merry Go 'Round was about marijuana - added: 'Weed's nice. Weed makes me a nicer person I think.'

Kacey - who became more 'compassionate' after tripping - went on to praise psychedelics for 'opening your mind in a lot of ways.'

'It doesn't have to be scary,' Musgraves explained to the mag.

'People in the professional worlds are using it, and [micro-dosing is] starting to become an option for therapy. Isn't that crazy?'

Coincidentally, the Oh, What a World hitmaker's husband Ruston Kelly tweeted on Wednesday: 'Being sober is the new stoned tbh s*** is already whack all the time.'
